Initiator
module automatic Initiator

TCP/IP SystemVerilog SHUNT Initiator module for SystemVerilog-to-Python communication

This module serves as the server in a client-server communication model between SystemVerilog and Python domains. It demonstrates a comprehensive testing of all supported data types over TCP/IP.

The module initializes a socket connection and performs loopback tests for a wide range of data types to verify bidirectional communication.

Variables
Socket
int Socket

Socket descriptor for TCP/IP communication

Pass
int Pass

Test pass/fail status flag

h_trnx_exp
cs_header_t h_trnx_exp

Expected transaction header for data validation

h_trnx_act
cs_header_t h_trnx_act

Actual transaction header received from the target

h_data_exp
cs_data_header_t h_data_exp

Expected data header for data validation

Only defined when NO_CS_DATA_HEADER_T is not defined

h_data_act
cs_data_header_t h_data_act

Actual data header received from the target

Only defined when NO_CS_DATA_HEADER_T is not defined

Status
string Status

Test status message

Test_name
string Test_name

Current test name for reporting

Functions
init_initiator
function int init_initiator(
int 
portno
)

Initializes the initiator (server) socket for TCP/IP communication

Parameters
portno
int

Port number to listen on. If 0, uses the default port.

Returns
socket_id

Socket descriptor for established connection

function int short_loopback_test(
int 
socket_id

Tests the loopback functionality for short (16-bit) integer data type

Sends a random short value to the target and validates the received response

Socket descriptor for the established connection

Returns
success

1 if test passes, 0 if fails

intV_loopback_test
function int intV_loopback_test(
int 
socket_id
)

Performs a loopback test for fixed-size int array data type

Parameters
socket_id
int

Socket identifier for the connection

Returns
success

1 if test passed, 0 if failed

Notes

Tests sending and receiving fixed-size int arrays (size defined by V_SIZE macro) Uses direct shunt_dpi_send_intV and shunt_dpi_recv_intV functions instead of handshake protocol

success

1 if test passed, 0 if failed

Notes

Tests sending and receiving integer arrays with random values including X states Uses strict 4-state equality comparison (!==) to verify exact matches

 = 
1
)

int

int

Returns
success

string s_me = "header_loopback_test()"

Function name for debug messages

int success = 1

Functions
print_status
function void print_status(
string 
Test_name,
int 
Status_int
)

Utility function to display test results

Parameters
Test_name
string

Name of the test being reported

Status_int
int

Status flag (1 for PASS, 0 for FAIL)

Returns

void

Notes

Converts numeric status to human-readable PASS/FAIL string and displays it

Variables
Status
string Status

String representation of test status ("PASS" or "FAIL")

Functions
print_shunt_header
function automatic void print_shunt_header(
cs_header_t 
h_,
string 
name_in
 = 
"",
string 
i_am
)

Prints all fields of a cs_header_t structure to the simulation log

Parameters
h_
cs_header_t

Header structure to print

name_in
string

Optional name to display with the header (default: "")

i_am
string

Module/function identifier string for debug messages

compare_shunt_header
function automatic bit compare_shunt_header(
cs_header_t 
lhs,
cs_header_t 
rls
)

Compares two transaction headers for equality

Compares all fields of the transaction headers and prints debug information

Parameters
lhs
cs_header_t

Left-hand side header to compare

rls
cs_header_t

Right-hand side header to compare

Returns
success

1 if headers match, 0 if different

Variables
s_me
string s_me = "compare_shunt_header(
lhs,
rls
)"

Function name for debug messages

success
bit success = 1

Comparison result flag (1 = match, 0 = different)
